questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said, "I am happy."
options: He said that I am happy
He said that he was happy
He said that he is happy
He said that I was happy
questions.explanation: 'I' changes to 'he', 'am' (present) changes to 'was' (past). Correct: He said that he was happy.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: She said, "I am going to Delhi."
options: She said that she is going to Delhi
She said that I am going to Delhi
She said that she was going to Delhi
She said that I was going to Delhi
questions.explanation: 'I' changes to 'she', 'am going' (present continuous) changes to 'was going' (past continuous).

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said, "I have finished my work."
options: He said that he has finished his work
He said that he had finished his work
He said that I have finished my work
He said that I had finished my work
questions.explanation: 'I' changes to 'he', 'have finished' (present perfect) changes to 'had finished' (past perfect).

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: She said, "I will go tomorrow."
options: She said that she will go tomorrow
She said that she would go the next day
She said that I will go tomorrow
She said that I would go the next day
questions.explanation: 'I' changes to 'she', 'will' changes to 'would', 'tomorrow' changes to 'the next day'.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said, "I can do it."
options: He said that he can do it
He said that I can do it
He said that he could do it
He said that I could do it
questions.explanation: 'I' changes to 'he', modal 'can' changes to 'could' in indirect speech.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: She said, "I saw him yesterday."
options: She said that she saw him yesterday
She said that she had seen him the previous day
She said that I saw him yesterday
She said that she has seen him yesterday
questions.explanation: 'I' changes to 'she', 'saw' (simple past) changes to 'had seen' (past perfect), 'yesterday' changes to 'the previous day'.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: She said, "Where do you live?"
options: She asked where I lived
She asked where do I live
She asked that where I lived
She said where I lived
questions.explanation: 'Said' changes to 'asked', question becomes statement form, 'do...live' changes to 'lived'. Correct: She asked where I lived.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said, "What are you doing?"
options: He asked what I was doing
He asked what am I doing
He asked that what I was doing
He said what I was doing
questions.explanation: 'Said' changes to 'asked', question form changes to statement form. 'Are...doing' changes to 'was doing'.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: She said, "When did you arrive?"
options: She asked when I arrived
She asked when I had arrived
She asked when did I arrive
She asked that when I arrived
questions.explanation: 'Said' changes to 'asked', 'did arrive' (simple past) changes to 'had arrived' (past perfect).

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said, "Are you happy?"
options: He asked if I am happy
He asked if I was happy
He asked that if I was happy
He said if I was happy
questions.explanation: 'Said' changes to 'asked', add 'if' or 'whether', 'are' changes to 'was'. No 'that' with 'if'.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: She said, "Do you like coffee?"
options: She asked if I like coffee
She asked if I liked coffee
She asked that if I liked coffee
She said if I liked coffee
questions.explanation: 'Said' changes to 'asked', add 'if/whether', question form becomes statement form, 'do like' changes to 'liked'.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said to me, "Please help me."
options: He ordered me to help him
He requested me to help him
He said me to help him
He told me help him
questions.explanation: 'Please' indicates a request. Use 'requested' + object + to + verb. 'Me' becomes 'him' in reported speech.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: She said to him, "Go away."
options: She requested him to go away
She ordered him to go away
She advised him to go away
She said him to go away
questions.explanation: Without 'please', it's a command. Use 'ordered' + object + to + verb.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said to me, "Don't waste time."
options: He advised me to waste time
He advised me to not waste time
He advised me not to waste time
He ordered me don't waste time
questions.explanation: This is advice. Use 'advised' + object + not to + verb. 'Not to' (not 'to not').

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said, "How beautiful the sunset is!"
options: He exclaimed that how beautiful the sunset is
He exclaimed with joy that the sunset was very beautiful
He said that the sunset is beautiful
He exclaimed that the sunset is very beautiful
questions.explanation: Exclamatory sentences use 'exclaimed with emotion'. 'How' is removed, 'very' is added, and 'is' changes to 'was'.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: She said, "Alas! I am ruined."
options: She exclaimed with joy that she was ruined
She exclaimed with sorrow that she was ruined
She said that she was ruined
She exclaimed that she is ruined
questions.explanation: 'Alas' expresses sorrow. Use 'exclaimed with sorrow', 'am' changes to 'was'.

questions.questionText: Convert to indirect speech: He said, "May you live long!"
options: He prayed that I may live long
He wished that I might live long
He said that I may live long
He exclaimed that I might live long
questions.explanation: Wishes use 'wished' or 'prayed'. 'May' changes to 'might'. 'You' changes to 'I'.

questions.questionText: Convert to direct speech: He said that he was tired.
options: He said, 'I am tired'
He said, 'He is tired'
He said, 'I was tired'
He said, 'He was tired'
questions.explanation: Indirect to direct: 'he' changes to 'I', 'was' (past) changes to 'am' (present). Add quotation marks.
